Blog.post: Well, i've come to the realization that without a permit I can not experience the 'true' north carolina (hehe) Angela and I spent the previous Saturday at my house trying to find rides to go places. Sadly the only place we went was to the park and our own two feet carried us there. But that is okay I dare say that I need to get out more often and it was a beautiful day. So that was my weekend besides having my lazy bum on glued to the couch while my eyes were fasincated with the many colorful pictures on the screen in front of me. On Sunday I went to church for about an hour and than decided my 'headache' was too much for me to bear. My parents were highly disapointed in me and I was highly disapointed in my acting. Now, on Monday, I have faced the daily challenge of school and came out of it without any rewards or further knowledge. Thank-you under-paid teachers for wasting 6 hours of my life. The only thing I found out today was that when it's cold at lunch i should join Tom and Lisa on the ground because they are most highly entertaining and block the wind. I must admit it is very hard when you are thrown off schedule. On Saturday I thought it was Friday and started to get ready for school before my breother, while eating ice cream at 8:30 in the morning, told me that it was Saturday. Than on Sunday I thought it was Saturday and made my parents wait for me to get ready. And now today I woke up thinking it was Saturday and had a lovely argument with my father on why not to wake me up before 10. I got the impression that he enjoys making me realize that when i'm half-awake I can be quite the idiot and refuse to believe common sense. "You better live your best and act your best and think your best today, for today is the sure preparation for tomorrow and all the other tomorrows that follow." Harriet Martineau (1802 - 1876)

Today i went to school and enjoyed the pleasure of listening to the teachers drone on about things that I had no intention of giving my attention to. I was thoroughly dissapointed when I realized that I could be at the zoo. My parents thought it was high time to take Caroline to the zoo while my grandparents were in town. I could have gone but thinking that I should go and be responsible to my studies. Though I have come to the conclusion that it was a pointless effort due to the fact that the whole day my mind was wandering to that of penguins and giraffes. I learned nothing today and it was a waste of my time. After school I traveled to the local McDonalds with friends and had a highly entertaining conversation about their social lives. My greasy double cheeseburger has kept my food processing unit happy up till now and I don't think it will settle for anything less than something fattening. I have therefore punished it and decided to eat a celery stick. "An intellectual is a person who has discovered something more interesting than sex." Aldous Huxley (1894 - 1963)

Well as of late I feel like I just stepped in a big turd. Oh man what can I say but life sucks. School has become the biggest pain in the ass I could ever think of. I wish I could just kind of freeze time and do things at my own pace but it doesn't exactly work that way now does it? Too bad it would help me loads. Yeah so hmmm I really don't want to go into my life right now. I don't feel good and my head feels like someone has wedged a permanet nail in there. I told some advil but it doesn't seem to want to help me. Instead it made my stomach upset. God is punishing me, see Angela I told you he would... I should have never bought it. Oh dear, well. What's done is done and i'm going to bed. "I hate to advocate drugs, alcohol, violence, or insanity to anyone, but they've always worked for me." Hunter S. Thompson (1939 - )

Hmm, what happened today. I'm pretty sure absolutely nothing happened today. I kinda just sat in a stupor while my teachers droned on about things that I kind of ignored and blocked out of my head. Yeah, oh wait i'm sorry something did happen today, the elections! See today was the Junior class elections and this was one of the hardest elections EVER! See for class president my two good friends Alyson Zandt and Emily Morro were running... oh that was hard, ouch. And than fro Junior Class Vice President it was Angela and Andrea.... SO HARD HARD HARD... EW OW! haha... yeah well Angela threatened to kill me if i didn't vote for her *whimper* yeah and the rest didn't matter... cept Missy because she rocks! "Imagine if every Thursday your shoes exploded if you tied them the usual way. This happens to us all the time with computers, and nobody thinks of complaining." Jeff Raskin, interviewed in Doctor Dobb's Journal

Today was a real drag. I don't know why it's just that nothing really seemed to fit into place. You know how when you get a brand new puzzle and you're doing it for the first time and all the pieces (dont' know how to spell that word, had to go use spellchecker, i'm such a loser) fit exactly how you want them too. But as time goes on and you keep on doing the puzzle some peices don't seem to quite fit as well. One is too, one doesn' t seem to match, the color has been worn down. Yeah well that's kind of how I feel. I wish I could just be new again...maybe i should take a bath or take a nap but nah... it doesn't seem to fit. I had a test today in English and I don't think it went to well, it was an essay test and I didn't know much about the subject so I kinda just pretended that I did. Yeah and in Chemistry I found out I made a 53 on the test. Oh dear, nothing seems to be going quite right. "In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous." Aristotle (384 BC - 322 BC), Parts of Animals

Well today has been boring and going to school was a just a reminder of how I forgot to do my homework over the break. Oh joy. In Algebra2 I remembered that I haven't taken a test and I don't understand any of the information it's on, great. Yeah and in Drama I need to memorize my lines and figure out my mesurments for my costume. Blah. Yeah and in ELPS we have a big quiz on wednesday, not the greatest thing i've heard so far. Yeah and than in English we had part one of the test today, which wasn't hard because it was just multiple choice but tomorow is the essay and I don't think i'm going to do so well on that. Yep and in Chorus I need to remember lines for a song... grr, woof. Yep and in chemistry... uh, chemistry is okay nevermind. Five weeks til the end of school! Whee! I'm so excited... except when I think of exams than i get kind of cold and start to shiver. June 7th is OUR PARTY! WHEE! Alright... let's get started on those invitations... lol. "Live in such a way that you would not be ashamed to sell your parrot to the town gossip." Will Rogers (1879 - 1935)

Today was a good day. My parents came home today and relieved me of the duty of baby-sitting my lovely baby sister. I was greatly rewarded though from my father with 100 dollars. Yes, and when they came home my mother decided to hold an Easter hunt. It mainly consisted of my little sister, Caroline, running around manically pointing out eggs and placing them in Nathan's outstretched shirt. Than my mother so graciously handed me my easter basket. I must say i'm thourougly pleased. Money would have been more useful but still i'm very happy. I cleaned and sorted out my candy jars and had a joyful experience throwing out lollipops that I had no idea existed. I'm happy and I hope you are too. "It is difficult to produce a television documentary that is both incisive and probing when every twelve minutes one is interrupted by twelve dancing rabbits singing about toilet paper." Rod Serling (1924 - 1975)

Today in the morning Angela and I decided to do strong libs at homestarrunner.com here are the results... Strong MadLib 1: HARD LIKE CLOTHES. I FROLICK DOWN ON THE WORLD BELOW. ALL WILL PRANCE AT MY THROAT. BEHOLD MY HOT BANANA. I AM STRONG MAD. I AM REESE WITHERSPOON. Strong Bad Lib1: My idiot brother Jordan is such a pizza suace! When I lay him, he pays. When he loses a thong, he pays. And when I call him a pizza sauce, he pays!! I hate my idiot brother Jordan. Strong Bad Lib2: The other day I was at a bedroom eating balls when out of nowhere came this long guy. I could tell he had serious floor problems from the get-go. His chest was all slick and stank like Angela. A pot was hanging out of his pants. He fell down in a puddle of hot choclate. I laughed my buttocks off. "No one goes there nowadays, it's too crowded." Yogi Berra
Life is a Drag. "It is possible to fail in many ways...while to succeed is possible only in one way." Aristotle (384 BC - 322 BC), Nichomachean Ethics

Okay, hey everyone again! I haven't been on here in awhile but i've been busy... no not really i'm just lazy. Well, last Saturday was delightfully fun. I finally went to the zoo... first time in my life! Well, that i could remember at least. Hmm, yeah well we had a lot of fun having the zebras stick their butts at us. Us... that is Emily F, Tom Martain, and I. Yeah well it was great. And we were going to get Angela a present but sadly we coudlnt' quite fit the elephant in Emily's hair. Yeah, well the car ride up was a bunch of fun and the ride home was too we were having fun listning to music. Yeah... hmm and I was blowing bubbles into Tom's face, not on purpose but... yeah... wind was just not working with me. Yeah well... an update on school. Hmm. Nathan has officially dropped out of school for this year. He said so this morning. This sucks. But in ELPS we has this paper due and well sadly our computer got a virus and my paper was deleted... wouldn't be such a problem if i hadn't lost the rough draft I had printed out... but i did. Yeah on Wednesday I have an essay due on a topic that I totally do not understand and will not understand for.. hmm a long time. Okay, well i'm having fun having my grades drop in my classes.. yeah right. This week is going to be really crazy at school. Well... hmm see today I only went to 4th-6th because of... issues with my back and my dad... but that's okay and than tomorow the sophmores have to take this field test in first and second and than on wednesday we have to take it in third and fourth... yeah and thursday and friday we have off...Yeah well that's about it for school... i think. Yeah.. yeah that's good. Okay, well this week is going to be fun. Because well... almost no school, but not because of that. But um... on Thursday and Friday my parents are gone because my brother is graduating from the Navy and they're going to the ceremony. Yeah and so I have to baby-sit my sister and angela is coming over on thursday to help me until Friday. And John is going to come over and hang out with us too... probally going to spend the nighty also. WHEEE PARTY! Hahaha. Angela and I are happy because John has a car and a legal license! WOO we can actually DO SOMETHING! Yeah! hahah... oh i was supposed to call john... right.. oh dear... BYE! "Laugh and the world laughs with you, snore and you sleep alone." Anthony Burgess (1917 - 1993)

Today was delightfully fun. And that is all you need to know. Jen and I have come to the conclusion that teddy grahms are not as they appear, you think they are tiny harmless crackers to fill your tummy in delight. But no, they are so much more. Tomorow I am going to Jen's hut and we will be studying and videotaping the secret rituals of the teddy grahms. For some odd reason jumping jacks has found a way into their culture and we are trying to get it all on tape. Tomorow will be the day of truth for the teddy grahms... I challenge everyone out there to follow your own dreams. I know how hard it is today in our societ to try and be someone different. We all like to mold ourselves into what society thinks is acceptable. We go throught our daily routines not challenging what we believe because we like to feel safe. If we challenge ourselves it's a risk. So instead of risking it we choose to be the typical person. Well, hmm, maybe I make no sense and you have no idea what i'm talking about so i'll put it in a more famous term... be yourself. "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music which he hears, however measured or far away." Henry David Thoreau (1817 - 1862), Walden, Conclusion, 1854

Well today was a wonderful crappy day. I did get to go to school late though which i enjoyed. In most of my classes I really didn't do much so it was a waste of my time. Well actually, chorus was quite fun. My friends and I got to draw very entertaining pictures on our poster about nationalism in the Romantic Period...hmm, they had nothing to do with them but it was fun anyways. Today was very beautiful and I actually did my homework like yesterday. I just go outside and sit my pretty self down on our back porch and do my homework. After dinner I wernt to church and walked two miles for a requirement I had to reach for a trek i'm doing this summer. Wow, excitement. Yes, okay well an apple is waiting for my tummy, they have a dinner date. Tata. "Tip the world over on its side and everything loose will land in Los Angeles." Frank Lloyd Wright (1869 - 1959)

Well just for the randomness of it, i took a quiz today about what kind of kiss i am and here it is You have a mysterious kiss. Your partner never knows what you're going to come up with next; this creates great excitement and arousal never knowing what to expect. And it's sure to end in a kiss as great as your mystery. urlLink What kind of kiss are you? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla

What do you do when you feel like your failing life? I mean, when you're failing a class or something like that you can always try harder and manage to pass it. But with life how exactly do you try harder? I don't know, I bet someone out there would love to give me a lecture on how to live my life and all of that but I really don't want that. Well hmm, I dunno guess i'll see what happens. One more week of school and i'm out! Wheee, this summer is going to rock. I can't wait to get out of the house and get away from my family. Ribs tonight, i'm gone! "My favorite animal is steak." Fran Lebowitz (1950 - )

Well, today I had my Algebra 2 test and i think I did quite well, by that I mean I think I got an A not only and A but a 100! Ahh, but soon my hopes will be dashed to the floor when we get our tests are returned and I realize that I was wrong, dead wrong. Yeah well... I tried and that's all matters...*sigh* how depressing. Well onto better news... um, give me a moment to think. Okay well, there is not better news just to let you know. Yeah, nothing special. (love this quote, may he rest in peace) "Good-bye. I am leaving because I am bored." George Saunders, last words

Okay well I haven't really updated lately but you know... what would I say? The usual "oh and in this class I did this" but that kind of gets old wouldn't you think? Well what is there to say? Hmmm, I don't know. I mean school isn't really that great of a thing right now. Too many tests, people are stressing the whole end of the year exams... i mean what's up with that? Whatever... haha. Okay so maybe I'm just lazy or something like that but whatever. My mother has called me fat. Yeah, isn't that so sweet. Okay so it wasn't really a direct statement... okay she didn't say I was fat at all but I got the intention that she was calling me that anyway. And well, if I say that she didn't say that... it wouldn't be worth mentioning in here would it now? Well anyways, I was making my lunch and I asked my mother if she had any of those yummy mints left and she looked at me and said, "Victoria you should eat healthier foods you eat too much junk" Well... if that is not implying i'm fat I don't know what is. I mean yeah... whatever i'm done. "Look to your health; and if you have it, praise God and value it next to conscience; for health is the second blessing that we mortals are capable of, a blessing money can't buy." Izaak Walton (1593 - 1683
JERK! GROW UP, GEEZ! FOR ONCE IN YOUR LIFE JUST BE MATURE!

It's over. The mother fucking tormenter of my life is gone from my schedule. For 3 months i'm free from it's tormenting and it's prison walls. Nathan failed. And I didn't! TAKE THAT YOU SON OF A BITCH! YOU FAILED YOU JERK, HOW DOES IT FEEL, HUH? Oh and it doesn't stop there. Not only does he get the humiliation of failing and being in MY grade next year but he also gets his license taken away by the state oh and he's grounded too! Why does this make me so happy? Because from now on I drive to school and for every FUCKING DAMN TIME THAT HE'S MADE ME LATE I'M GOING TO TAKE HIM TWICE AS FUCKING EARLY! THAT'S RIGHT YOU BASTARD EVERYTIME I WAS LATE TO CLASS I'M GOING TO DROP YOU OFF EARLY AND MAKE YOU GO TO STUDY HALL! Oh dear, got a little angry. My grandmother's dying. Her health is failing fast and this summer is the last chance i get to see her. Life is too up and down for me. I wish it would stop. "Death is nothing to us, since when we are, death has not come, and when death has come, we are not." Epicurus (341 BC - 270 BC), from Diogenes Laertius, Lives of Eminent Philosophers

Okay... sorry bout that guys but i haven't posted in like FOREVER! Ahh... and too much stuff has happened meaning i have a lot to write... and I don't know if i'm really up for it. Oh well... so I come back to blogger and the site has like...completely revamped the whole site... i was like... crazy man! So I'm kinda all comfused and turned around but that's okay... it's a fresh start. So onto my summer thing a ma bob. So anyways... after school left out my church hosted this whole trek thing. And we hiked for 4 days with handcarts and it was raining and muddy and i lost my shoes in the mud because it sucked them off and i couldn't find them and i was just kind of like who cares... but anyways... it was a lot of fun. And i would tell you WHY we did it but that's like this whole story in itself so i'll just some it up for you in a few words... i'm mormon. Yeah so than the week after that I flew out to Utah to go to this seminar (a mormon seminar). And it was SOOO much fun. It's called EFY, Ecspecially For Youth, and it was just crazy fun. We stayed on the BYU campus and we were in these families kind of things. And we went to a bunch of classes and seminars... and we did a bunch of games and things. I met a whole bunch of people and some really hott guys... too bad i'll probally never see them again in my life and if i actually wrote them or called them (b/c i did get their addresses and numbers of course) they would probally totally be like 'who are you?' or 'why is this girl calling me?'... you know, something along those lines... but that's cool... i'm not hurt by that or anything :( Okay... so than for the rest of the summer i've pretty much sat on my butt and have done NOTHING! Wow... cool eh? So anywho... i've caught up and i'll try and stay up with this blogger... not that anyone reads it or anything... and if you do, great for you! Yeah... so... later. "Ambition is a poor excuse for not having sense enough to be lazy." Edgar Bergen (1903 - 1978)

True to the title of my blog... I was looking at the road i've taken in my life. I came to the conclusion that i'm not satisfied and in a way I feel dirty. Some of the choices i've made have not kept up to my expectations that I hold for myself. I know that this world and its tempations are hard to ignore but I wished that I had a higher expectations of myself but truthfully due to some of my friends slowly those walls have crumbled. I start to compromise that if I do this it's okay because of some reason which, in truth doesn't make sense. Some of the things I really regret and feel the pressure of guilt closing in. So, i've decided that it's time that I turn back. I know that once you're down a path it's hard to turn back but I really want to. The problem is I made it all the way by myself... does that mean I have to make it back that way too? I really hope not, I hope there is someone out there that I know that will help me along the way. Is it you? If I asked you... would you help? "The ultimate test of a relationship is to disagree but hold hands." Alexander Penney
No matter how hard I try, I always end up getting hurt. "I reached for sleep and drew it round me like a blanket muffling pain and thought together in the merciful dark." Mary Stewart
lalala this is megan, not tori

Okay guys... i'm totally dissapointed in Isabella... I expected so much more from her. I mean, I know it's hard to compare to a cousin with the name of Fran... but I thought she could do much better than this. I mean... the lightning and thunder was exciting for about.... the two seconds it lasted. Than, the winds were mighty cool... the best part about it. I mean, I went outside in my swimsuit later on when it was really blowing and raining and kind of just hung out outside. It was pretty cold so I started dancing to keep myself warm. I'm pretty awesome. So, than for the rest of the day I was inside drawing. I had a good time. So... I took a typing test the other day and I got 77wpm and like a 92% accuracy. I'm pretty wowed by this. I mean... the last time I checked (6th grade) I could only type like 54... which to let you know... I was the fastest in the class! So... I think I'm pretty awesome. Haha... i'm not vain. You know... I was thinking about this. If you say you're not vain, you obviously are because only a vain person would think they're not vain. But if you say you're vain than you obviously aren't because a vain person wouldn't think they're vain. So either way, you can't win. So what to do when someone asks if you're vain. I would leave it up for them to decide I guess.... I mean, if someone has to ask you if you're vain in the first place... well, than... that's sad. (you're sad --- right megan?!) Also on a side note... I would like to apologize to Nathan because I spelled his name wrong in my last post (which I now have fixed) I was typing and wasn't watching and I spelled it Lambe.... now let me tell you... that is not how you spell Lamb. I would have lost in a spelling bee... well I DID lose in a spelling bee, but that was a long time ago. (9th grade... JUST KIDDING. It was 5th) And also... I was not making fun of his last name... his last name rocks and mine doesn't. I bow down to the mighty last name of Nathan. ... and a side note to Megan, we WILL watch Fido goes west and the Emperor's new groove (... what does that have to do with anything? No, no he does have a point...) and also... we will try those cookies again... something we did just wasn't right. Elaina Rocks. " The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds new discoveries, is not 'Eureka!' (I found it!) but 'That's funny ...' " Isaac Asimov (1920 - 1992)

Hey guys, I'm actually over at megan's house which is totally awesome because well... MEGAN ROCCCCCCCKKKKKKKKS MY SOOOOOCKSS! hahha... nice eh? And her brother and his SSSSSSSOOOOOOOOOOOO hot friends are over. haha... ecspecially Neko... who is the coolest little short mexican ever, i mean this kid is awesome.. i would marry him if he was like... 5 years older. Haha. Yeah, nice. They're all playing x-box... dorks, losers, no lifes... yeah. Well anywho, let me tell you about today! I had detention for the FIRST TIME IN MY LIFE... i mean talk about changing your out look on life. But actually... it was fun. See, at our school... detention is a new thing really so they're not too good punishing us. What i had to do was run around the school and empty the recycling bins into the larger ones outside. Which is actually pretty nasty but not when you're doing it with Catherine and Frank... they're awesome. And because the teacher let me out a minute early.... oooooooooo... yeah i'm awesome. Oh man guys, conflict of friends. Just when life starts to even out... i hit the jacpot of all potholes. Nah, maybe it's not that serious. Well, I don't know... switching schools in the middle of Junior year... maybe that is pretty serious. See, i'm not sure what to do. There's a lot of reasons why I should and shouldn't do it and I don't think i'll get a good response from any of my friends because they'll be leading to the school of their choice, not knowing what the other one has to offer. So, when life all of a sudden splits into two... both paths seeming the same at the beginning but at the end change so drastically... how are you supposed to pick and know what you've chosen is right. Unlike some paths in life... this one I can't turn around and go back, there's no shortcuts to the other one if the one I choose gets too hard. This is an all or nothing choice and i'm not sure how to handle it. I know sometimes I appear to take things a little carefree on the surface... i'm sure some of you who i've talked to about this think that I don't care, but really... this is something that i'm really being challegned over. Maybe change is good. "The first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: Decide what you want." Ben Stein

I would have to say that Autumn is my favorite season of all. When you go outside there's a very distinct smell that is very crisp. If I had to choice which season I would live in my entire life it would definitly be Autumn. The weather is perfect, or at least where I live, it's not too hot or cold. It's the right time to go down to the beach and just have an all out blast of fun. The season is just full of vibrant colors and the sky always looks so perfect. Sometimes I wish I could just fly up into it and never come down, I think Angela knows what i'm talking about. These are the perfect days just to go outside and run in a field. I'm hoping i'll do that this saturday. Yeah, i'll get Angela to go with me... or Megan. We'll go down to pullen park for the day and do the paddle boats, the train, the merry-go-round. Yeah, i'm hoping this will work. Anyone who wants to come let's do it! Let's be spontaneous... well I don't know how spontaneous you can be when you plan something the Sunday before-hand.... but hey, you know what... it's OKAY! Alright this is going to be great... i'm excited! YEAH! "It was one of those perfect English autumnal days which occur more frequently in memory than in life." P. D. James

I would just like to say that I envy all you people out there that have really good mother-daughter realationships. I think that is so great that you guys do the whole mother-daughter movie nights or dinners. Or even if you don't do that but you and your mom are on at least good speaking terms and understand each other. See, I don't have that, i've never had that and I don't think I ever will. But you see, now at this point in my life I don't think I could accept it if it was offered to me. See ever since I was a kid my mother has ignored me. Not like you might think... oh yeah she came to all my concerts and helped me on my homework. She put on a great facade... she even fooled me for awhile. But no matter what I did I could never measure up to how great my sister was. See, my sister and mom had that great 'connection' that some parents have with their kids... I don't know, maybe i'm not capable of that, maybe it's my fault but I don't think i'll ever know. Even when my mom and sister did include me in those things I was still never really included. When we walked I was always behind, the conversations were too grown-up for me... so finally I just stopped accepting their offers and than they stopped offering them. As I sit here and think about this, maybe I wouldn't be so hurt if my mom truly knew what my sister was like. You see my sister was a great deceiver of all sorts. My mom thought she was little miss perfect... that she never did anything wrong. But I saw it all, I knew of everything she did but I never told... I always kept it to myself, afterall... it wasn't my place to tell. But if I ever did anything wrong, which compared to her deeds was nothing more than a simple slip up in the path of my life, but she would always tell and I would get in trouble. Still, I never told though. But because of this I slowly started to feel contempt for my sister, I tried hard to get along but we are so different. Everything I did in my sister's eyes was considered childish, immature, or stupid. She would always compare me to herself and how I should become more like her. And because I hated my sister my mother hated me. My life, most would say has been pretty easy and I won't disagree. Compared to others life styles I know that I'm blessed with things they can't even comprehend but still... I think I would give up most everything I have just to have a good relationship with a mother I could love. See, where most people had somebody to lean on in the most trying times of their life I had nobody. I thought I could depend on a friend but in the end even that ended in disaster. She hurt me really badly and I don't think i'll ever really recover from that. Because of her and some others I have a hard time trusting people, i've learned through those experiences that trust in itself is deceitful. But that's not to say I haven't recovered. In the past three years I have met some of the most wonderful people ever. I could never find better friends than them. They mean so much to me and have helped me a lot. I'm sure they don't know it and probally could never truly understand what they mean to me. But I would just like to let them know that they are my world and without them I would be nothing. These people might not even be my best friend either... they are just people that give me an encouraging word when i'm feeling down. Or when i'm not having a bad day they don't ask about it but instead give me a smile and a funny story. These people mean everything to me and I hope that they understand they have changed my life and I love them forever for that. "Don't walk behind me, I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me, I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." Albert Camus (1913 - 1960) (attributed)

I'm only posting because I feel like I have to keep this good blogging up. You know... good luck, or some type of shit like that. Rant of Today Why do people say I could care less? If you really think about this, it doesn't make sense whatsoever. You see, people tend to say this when they don't care at all. For example... when Jordan asks me if I want to hear about how some kid stuffed a frog in their pants at school... I tell him I could care less... when in reality I don't care at all. See, when you say that phrase, "I could care less", you're implying that you cared in the first place. To care LESS means that something has to be there to detract from it. Now, you could say, 'what about negatives?'... but in this sense to have negative caring means you would have to hate it... and when we say I could care less... we don't hate (or discriminate) we just truly don't care. So from now on when you say "I could care less".... ask yourself did you care in the first place?

TONIGHT ROCKED! I must say Angela and Tom are two of the most fun people to do random stuff with. We had this plan to go to this garden place and that totally never happened. But anyways, here is what happened... Angela picked me up at the school parking lot because I don't like driving downtown and we headed over to Tom's house. After we all got into Tom's car we drove downtown for a bit and ended up parking at Moore's Park (I think.. something like that) We then proceeded to hang out in city market with NOBODY there. I mean, it was DESERTED! So we just proceeded to walk around downtown doing nothing in particular. Then we went to the mall with NOBODY there.. again! So we just sat on the empty fountain and talked about guys... well... girls for Tom. Then we went over to ANOTHER fountain and hung out in that one too. After that we decided we wanted to do something else and went back to his car. On the way I was having fun dancing in the middle of the road. I mean, no cars were coming so I just was dancing and twirling... great fun. After we got in the car Angela and I were having fun yelling at the windows. Tom has this really cool thing that if you yell up/down at the windows they respond. Well... we were trying to confuse the windows by yelling them at the same time. We were also yelling silly words like DOWNtown. Krispy Kreme is great. I mean, REALLY great! We went there afterwards and we just got some doughnuts and milk and ate them. Go figure. Their bathrooms have really funny sinks though. I mean, they're itty bitty! After doughnuts we headed out to a park. We were having great fun swinging in the swings. First Tome and I got married and then divorced with no kids. Then Angela and Tom were married and had a kid named Augustus... i'm not sure if we ever decided it was a boy or a girl? Then me and Angela were married... that did not last long. After the swings we ran over to this HUGE hill and rolled down it a couple of times. Angela and I were continuously crossing paths for some odd reason but never ran into each other. After we were done rolling we decided it would be fun to lay on Tom. So Tom for awhile had us laying on him... he's a very comfortable pillow and it's hilarious laying on his tummy when he laughs. Well then we got the grand idea to go streaking. So me and Angela take our shirts off and run around the field in our bras. I'm so glad tonight was warm because it felt so good with the wind against my skin. Then Tom takes off his shirt and runs around. It seemed like he was a little more conscious about it then me and Angela. Well... then we decided taking our shirts off just wasn't enough. So we rip off our pants and decide to run around the field with only our undies on. Tom was just so hilarious in his boxers. This kid is so much fun! So we finally begrudgingly put our clothes back on again, roll down the hill one more time and leave. Today was the best day i've had in forever. Thank-you friends, you are fantabulous. I love the swings. Angela and Tom have reunited my love for them.

Causing conflict pain is never an easy thing. Nobody wants to do it but inadvertently causes it anyways. Sometimes avoiding it only causes it to come quicker and strike harder. I really hope that someday I can look back on the pain that I've caused and realize that at least I tried to make it better. I don't know if that will happen nor do I know when in my life is a good time to stop and look back. If I stop and look back now I'm afraid I might break down and weep realizing the hurt that I've caused over such trivial things. I want you to know that your happiness means the world to me. Paying attention to what I want and feel gets you nowhere and will end getting you entangled in a mess you can't get out of. Don't ask for my help because my help will not be even and I'll try and tip the scale. I hope you find what you're looking for and everything works out. If not, I'm sorry and I'm here for you as a friend. I'm not asking for anymore then that, because in reality... I don't even deserve that.

I just don't care anymore. I'm sitting on the edge as it's crumbling all around me and I have the time to move but I just don't care. Piece by piece theledge is falling and inch by inch I'm getting closer to dying. I see the rocks falling to their doom and part of me screams to move but the other part of me wonders what it would be like to fall? What would it be like to just let everything go. My body starts to lean and my eyes begin to close. I'm ready to let go. But then I hear something "Wait" Wait? For What? I hear this simple word and stop. I sit back and open my eyes, I look to the left and to the right but nothings there. It must have been my imagination. I sigh and begin to close my eyes again but once again a voice stops me, "Don't go" I open my eyes and turn around. And there it is... A hand. It's reaching out to me. I look up to the face that claims the hand, but it's not just one. There's so many faces that belong to that hand. All of them are telling me to "Wait, don't go" Now the choice is mine, to grab on... or let go.
Brothers are SO annoying. Don't ever get one... and if you have one, i'm sorry.

Have you ever woken up one day and realized something about yourself. Something you wish you hadn't, a dark secret that nobody knows. But instead of changing it, you lock it away and ponder over it late into the night, when no one is there to watch you cry, nobody is there to comfort you, to hold you, to say to you it will be all right. Sometimes you just feel like giving up. Sometimes you just want to crawl up in the bed and have everything disappear, you wish that everyone would forget you. But instead of doing that, you wake up every morning and put on the same mask that you always wear. The mask you wore the day before. The mask that everyone thinks is you and only you know what's truly hidden beneath it. Sometimes, some of us have multiple masks. And certain people, people you think you can trust. You let them under one of them, maybe even two. But you never let them see what's underneath the last one, the one that is actually you. Who would want to see it? Would they gasp in horror and realize the monster that is actually you? Or would they not be impressed? Would they care? Who are we to say? Some of us have worn these masks for so long, we don't even take them off at night. We don't wash off the mask, because we don't want to. We don't want to remember who we are. We like our masks, they're pretty, they're beautiful, intelligent, talented, they're everything we wish we could be. The masks are everything, but we aren't. But one day, a small crack will appear. A crack in the mask, but just a small one. One that most of us wouldn't even notice. It doesn't take much to crack the mask, it's not hard. A comment, a gesture, a friend. Not many know what makes the crack appear, but soon more and more will come. They always do. Some might be able to stop it, patch it up, hide it. But others won't think much of them. The cracks will keep on growing larger, bigger, longer. And than, when you least expect it, the mask breaks. It could be anywhere. At school, at home, or when you're all alone. The mask will fall, and you will be revealed. For nobody can hide forever.

Feel like your a doll? Ever feel like you have a plastic face that can show no emotion? Feel like someone paints on your emotions and controls ever motion that you make? Do they dress you, feed you, plan out your life. Are you the puppet and the strings connect you to the puppet master? I am a doll. I don't feel pain, sorry, happiness, love, joy. These are the emotions the puppet master let's me borrow to play out the scene. She gave me love when the man of my life walks in. But as soon as that happens she takes that away and gives me anger for something that he has done... or is it something that the puppet master made him do. Then it always ends up with me being sad and the puppet master makes the man walk away with the flowers laying forgotten on the floor. Wherever I go... she follows... she has the strings, she carries my heart in her hands. I must do what she says because if I don't she'll tell them... She'll tell everyone that I'm just a doll. She'll let them see who I am... she'll take away the pretty clothes, she'll take away the plastic face, she'll take it all away and cut the strings. Than I'll fall, I'll fall for a long time, fall forever it will seem. But then sometime I'll hit the ground and everything will break. So for now, I must listen to the puppet master and obey her will. She taunts me. She rebukes me. She makes my life a living nightmare. She is always there and I must never let her know what I truly think. I must never tell her that I know what she is doing. I see the strings and I so desperately want to cut them. But I always forget... she makes me forget, she sometimes finds out that I know, so she makes me forget. She instead puts things into my heads, thoughts that aren't mine. She makes me believe things that I don't want to believe. I'm her toy, that's all. She can just press the reset button and it's all over... I have to start all over... so she must never know when I remember, she must NEVER know. She must always think that she has control. She must never know...never know... always believe... but never know. She's doing it again... thoughts that aren't mine I hate this...she's doing it to me... I'm forgetting again... That was something I wrote. Unlike the things I've previously written that does not describe a personal situation. I just wrote it when I was feeling down. Don't worry about me. Sometimes you can find quotes that hit home really hard. I hate those moments. "It is easier to exclude harmful passions than to rule them, and to deny them admittance than to control them after they have been admitted." Seneca (5 BC - 65 AD)

Can anyone out there say that they truly have friends? I mean in reality do you have the friends that you truly need? I think there are a few who are blessed with friends that would do anything for them. While there is the majority of us who don't. You might try and fool yourself into believing that you do, saying in your mind that no matter what, your friends will always be there for you. But have you ever thought what would happen in the end? Would your friend actually sacrifice themselves over you? Or would they just care for themselves and only that alone. Your friends say they will always be there for you, but where are they when you're on the edge, when you're toeing the line of insanity and reality. Do they dare try and help you? Do they reach they're arms out and say take my hand? How can they? To do that they'd have to come out of their secure boxes, their way of living, they have to change themselves to save you. They have to step out of their stable world and into yours. To save you they have to look inside you. Not just the outside, not just the underlying layer. They have to dig deeper, further, they have to reach into the core. They have to touch your core to understand, to see, to feel who and what you are. But who wants to do that? That's too dangerous. Who would actually risk doing that for you? Because reaching into the core means risking falling in, and who knows what will happen than. If you fall into someone how can you escape? Is there an escape? Is it possible? Not many know because not many will risk it. We're all selfish, we want and never give. If you're friend was toeing the line, what would you do? Would you even know? There are so many out there who step on that thin line everyday. They see both sides, they understand what's on one side and what's on the other. And they know which is easier. They know that insanity can bring them relief, and a sense of happiness. They know that insanity is a whole different realm of ideas and thoughts. People who are insane leave their bodies behind. They escape into a new world. But at a price. And the price is insanely high. It usually ends up hurting the ones you love. Nobody wants to do that. Nobody. So that's why they toe this line. They are sane enough to realize that the price is not worth it. The price is just too high. So instead they toe the line. They experience enough of it just to keep on going. But when somebody toes the line for too long they go to far. So do you know who is toeing the line? Do you ever actually stop to look and listen. To observe those around you. It could be your closet friend, or your worst enemy. It could be your father, mother, brother, sister. It could be the children you tend for, your teacher, your lover. It could even be you. Or maybe, you know somebody who toed the line for too long and couldn't take it. And you know the consequences. Do you ever stop to think and wonder... you could've helped? Or did you try and help but didn't try hard enough. If you would've known... would've you gone all the way to save them. Touched their core... gone to the line of insanity to bring them back? Or is the risk too high? Some of you might ask me how can I accuse them of such things? Well, I can because I have experienced both sides to the story. I have toed the line of insanity but nobody was there to help me. I had to fight the urge to take the jump, to plummet into the other world. I had to save myself and it was no easy task. I had nobody to urge me on, I had no help. But I have helped. I helped a friend when she was in need. Because I observed, I saw what was happening. And I helped. But I do not judge you, or criticize you. I only warn you. Look with open eyes and an open mind. Help when you can. Do what you can. Go to the line of insanity if you must. Because sometimes just realizing isn't enough.

Have you ever wished that you had an escape from life? Ever wanted to take an ordinary marker and draw a door to another world? A world where every dark desire of yours can come true? What if I was to tell you that I have found a doorway. I have found a window, an escape from the grays of this world. I have found colors that none have any other seen I have found worlds that others cannot imagine! Some would look on with full interest and wonder how I did it. Some would turn their heads and say impossible but out of the corner of their eye they still watch, hoping it could be true. While others would turn in scorn and walk away. To them, I give my love and hope that they find what they are looking for, I pray that they will come to realize that open hearts and minds are the happiest. And to those who peek but do no look. I give you courage and I give you strength. For you will need those to become what you want. You will need those to face the challenges of becoming who you are. And to those who give their all and are hopeful and do not hesitate. To those I congratulate. Today it is not easy to be one of us. It is not easy with the people who laugh and look upon us with contempt. For you know what you are don't you, You are a dreamer. A person of thoughts and hopes. For you I pray that you will stand tall and proud in this world of grays. I give you my love, so that you may shine about all. It is us who will find the door to other worlds. It is us we will escape through the windows and experience things like no other. How can I explain to you what I have experienced? How can I draw a picture for you of what I have seen? For these things are too vibrant and too full of emotions and feelings to put it into simple words... to draw with the dull colors that we have. But I will try. I will try to tell you of what I see. I have been to the corners of the world. I have been in the darkerst of jungles, hunted by beasts not many have seen. I have explored the pyramids of Egypt and fought for my life in the Amazon. I have experienced passionate love in the plains of Africa. I have touched magnificent beasts and seen them bow down to my will. I have brought peace. I have been the cherished leader of all. I've been a mother, a teacher, a lover, a ruler... I have been everyone's dream. I have been the heart of the people. These things I have known and things that I will know again when I rest my head and close my eyes. But this is not all. There is so much more that I cannot even begin to describe. I wish I could, but for fear of ruining what I treasure most, I dare not. I dare not destroy the things I've seen. For these are the things that keep me going on. They are the fuel to my fire, my soul. They are who I am. They are dreams, and I the dreamer.

If you look back on your life the only true person you can blame for your troubles and misery is yourself. People have always told me that sometimes when you have something and don't realize it... later on when it's gone they feel the loss. I always thought they were so silly. How can you not realize what you have? I always thought I would understand what was in my life and treasure it. Too bad life doesn't go as you want it to. I fainted today on the bathroom floor because i've been sick. When I came around I was just laying there and started thinking about things. I realized I've been carrying around this dead weight for awhile now... and for the past couple of weeks it's actually started effecting me. My moods have been somewhat forced when I'd rather just walk around as a zombie. I think it's also the cause of why I've been so sick these past couple of weeks. I had something really special... something I truly cared about. But a fear of myself and what I can do to others got in the way of my thinking. Instead of facing the problem, I ran... I ran as far as I could away. But not just from the problem... from myself. I really want what I had back, but I don't think I can get what I want. For once in my life I can't have it. Everything has come so easy to me but I realize even if I tried... it still would avoid me. I slowly progressed from the floor of my bathroom to the comfort of my bed. Even as comfortable as my bed is... it doesn't soften the pain. Under the covers I started to try and form a plan to resolve my pain. The only plan I came to though was to confront the situation.... that can't happen. If I did, so many more problems would arise from the situation. People would get hurt and things would be said. So for the time being all I can do is bury it deep within me. But that won't help for very long. As I've realized, you can only bury the past for so long... gravity doesn't work here... everything will rise eventually. I could try and forget about it... but i've also realized that subconsciously everything is stored until the worst possible moments. Maybe when i've finally confronted myself and realize why i'm so scared of me I can deal with this... but until than i'll just wade in my misery and hope to find an island which I can rest my weary self upon. "The power of hiding ourselves from one another is mercifully given, for men are wild beasts, and would devour one another but for this protection." Henry Ward Beecher (1813 - 1887)

Ahh, Christmas Day... what a wonderful time. We actually slept into 9. Do you understand how rare that is for us on Christmas? In fact, it's so rare... It's never happened. Well, I enjoyed waking up at 9...still a little grouchy, but hey... we can't get everything. Well... so we all go downstairs and behold the glory of the Christmas room. Yes, well... because my dad is so obsessed with "A Christmas Story" (great movie!) he decided he wanted to reenact part of the movie. Yes, we hid a BB gun behind the couch for Jordan. Mother didn't agree with the gun but father says "it's part of becoming a man"... my ass. Oh well... yeah, I got everything I wanted, except a car. Next year guys... next year. I think I did get enough perfumes to last me a lifetime. But I'm happy... I have a selection other then Bora Bora and Curve... woot. I also received 3 purses... rock on. I love purses... another kind of theme I got was.. you know those letter purses and that whole line of stuff? Well, I didn't know my parents accepted the fact that I'm called Tori and not Victoria... well I found out today that they do. All of the things I got were with T's... I'm so happy. A ring, a bracelet, a purse and a wallet. I think it might also have to do with the fact that there are no V's on that stuff. I was highly disappointed when they told me they had got me a 200$ gift certificate to Crabtree... but ended up not doing that because I got the cat... which overall cost about 150... I think somewhere around there. Well.... I'm not sure what I would've wanted. A cat... or a shopping spree. I need more clothes but they did give me 50 dollars which will cover a pair of pants... on sale. Oh well... live with what you've got. I guess... because I've got a job now I can deal. Well tonight is going to be fun-filled with games and such because we always do those things on on holidays. Last night we skipped because I saw Lord of the Rings. I'm glad to know I can ruin my whole family's source of entertainment just because I'm not there. Well... mother is calling me down for desert. It's tiramisu tonight... I love tiramisu!
Hey, I'm thinking of changing my blog colours... actually, I know I am. But what colour should I do... I'm thinking purple?

I don't want to stay up till 1:30 like I did with david last night... oh no no... sleep is good.

I cant help the fact that hes so large that his button popped off and hit me in the forehead (no joke). I HAD to say something to that. I probably couldve worded it better but anyways. I got my parents called on those particular comments. Got grounded for a month too. Man was I a bitter person during middle school. Well anyways back to tonight. After the concert David and I are walking out to his car. Yes, HIS car not mine! I mean Im the girl, shouldnt we stop by my car first. I mean, its not like David has to worry about strange men jumping out and molesting him. Maybe Michael Jackson.. But other then that, I think he has no worries. What a horrible gentlemen. Well anyways so we get to his car and what do we see? David is stuck. Pulled to close to the car in front of him and the guy behind pulled too close also. How funny. So anyways, David starts flipping out about how his parents are going to get pissed at him. Not like he has a CELL PHONE OR ANYTHING! Well, the smart-ass finally remembers what a cell phone is for and tries to call. Too bad for him his cell phone isnt working. Well then he gets the SMARTEST idea to try and take the battery out to fix it! about that! What is it with guys obsession to fix things? They always tend to screw things up even more. It must be a part of their manly/macho thing. Men, what to do with them? But anyways so not only is David stupid hes clumsy. He drops the battery under the car. And to show off his gentlemen like qualities he makes me get down and get it. What am I your bitch? Just consider that your Christmas gift David and the fact I didnt rip your head off when you called me Baby how degrading. So tries to put the battery back in, doesnt work. God must have really hated you tonight David. Well anyways so I want to leave but the poor baby needs to make sure nobody tries to attack him. So were just sitting around waiting for one of the car owners to come and leave. Finally the rear-end guy comes and goes. So David can leave. I hope this teaches you a lesson David.

Luckily... my comment to her distracted her enough to make her forget that she was asking for my fries. Therefore I ate the rest of them... yay! And who says 'pass' these days? She told me that we would get one at the gas station... 3 gas stations later... all I got was jolly ranchers... OH poo! Ahh, warm weather... oh how I have missed thee. So, today starts off pretty normal. Go to school, and it's school. Nothing special goes on and nothing bad happens. Then I get home. I hate home. So, it goes pretty normal until i'm talking to my dad about spring break. I don't want to go through it but in the end my dad said that if I wanted to leave then I should go ahead and do it. He told me he has no need for a daughter that doesn't want to be here. Then he said, there are three doors to our house, choose one and get out. So, I told him fine, give me a week and I'm gone. Now the problem is... the places where I could stay.. might not still be open. And then, where else do I go? Now that's the hard part. I can move in with my grandpa... who I know would let me. He lives out in Utah though... is giving up my friends worth my freedom. I want to say no, but it's what I've wanted for so long. Is it right for them to sacrifice my happiness for theirs? Is it right for me to hurt them? Nobody ever said life was easy. But nobody ever told me that I'd end up wishing I could just fade away.

A note to my parents... because I'll never be able to tell them in person. Mom... Dad, Before I begin to tell you this I'd just like to let you know, I don't hate you. Did you ever believe that I was good enough for you? Did you ever love me like you did the rest of my brothers and sisters? Why was it that I could try so hard to be the person that you wanted but I could never truly achieve that. What is so wrong with me that you could treat me so different from everybody else. I know you tell me that you never treated me different from any of the others. But who who are you trying to fool? I lived in this house my whole life and saw everything that went on. Garrett dropped out of school, started doing drugs, drinking and stopped going to church. Now, all you talk about is how much he's changed and how he's getting somewhere in life. Katherine slept around, she defied everything you asked of her. She didn't do anything she was told. Now she's mother's best friend. Dad's little angel. You buy her anything she wants, you pay for her college, her clothes, her phone, anything she asks and you give her. Nathan failed Junior year. He left the house without asking, you never knew where he was, he pretended you didn't exsist. What have you done with him? Nothing... because you say it's a different situation... that by punishing him it doesn't get him anywhere. And then there's me. I've always done exceptionally well at school. I did everything you asked. I was the child that everybody adored. I was perfect in the eyes of everybody else... except you. I brought home all A's but Katherine's B+ math test got put up on the fridge while my tests got thrown in some box up in the attic. I did dance, and art, and piano. But dad only came to Katherine's recitals and the boys basketball games. When mom asked me to do band... I did it and then her response was, "why aren't you 1st chair" when I was 4th. I tried to hard to be everything you could possibly want... but it was never enough. Now you're asking me why I didn't tell you this before? Well, I have but every single time I did I started crying and then you'd tell me to talk to you when I'm not emotional? How can you ask me not to be emotional about my pain? Do you not know how much you've hurt me? I don't think I'll ever get over this. They say time heals everything... I don't think time will help me. How can anyone get over being shunned by their parents? It's not a simple thing. So now... it's too late. Dont' even try because the wall is already up and 5 feet thick. No matter how hard you try, you're not getting in. I've got other people to take care of me now. Thanks... but no thanks. I'm fine without you. From you Daughter, Victoria

I always hurt people. No matter what my intentions are I can't help but rip out their hearts and leave them on the ground. I seriously don't know why I do it. Maybe it's because I was raised watching my sister and saw her do it to so many people. Maybe it's the fact that I've been hurt so many times in my life I feel like everybody else needs to feel part of the pain I have. I know part of it is because when I feel people get to close... I need them to back away and learn I'm not something you play with. Sure, I've gone through a lot of shit in my life. I 've had my heart ripped out more then once and thrown carelessly away. I've given my soul to others and all I got in return was a thank-you card. That still doesn't give me the right to hurt other people. Another thing... stop trying to understand me, none of you ever will. I hate when people say they know what I've been through... because I've never met one person in my life who truly has. Granted, I've never told a single person ALL that's happened to me, and I probally never will until I meet that one person in my life. I was talking to my cousin Jennifer today, the one person who knows everything. I've never hidden anything from her because I know she could never judge me. I could go out and sleep with 15 guys and she would never judge me. But today, I was over at her house and we were discussing this... and she even admitted that nobody could possibly understand the hurt I've been through in my life. Sure, I act like it's not really that big of a deal. You guys know something has happened but you really don't understand what... and I doubt you ever will. So please stop asking me what's happend. If I tell you it only opens old wounds that still need time to heal. Sometimes, you just have to learn that other people's past is not your own. You shouldn't touch things that aren't yours unless invited. And you shouldn't ask unless prompted.

Two things I learned today at the Spa: 1) the phrase "The price women pay for beauty" is really true... especially at Soigne (55 for a haircut? 95 for colour? please guys... do it yourself) 2) There are a lot of people who have dry, flaky skin behind their ears. Yes... this is nasty. Please people... give some loving to your ears! I mean... it's gross touching that stuff... I subconsciously touch my ears now to make sure I don't have that... ew. Got my ears pierced today. 16 years of worry of pain and I get there and I see a 6 year old do it and not cry... I got the nerves and did it. I cried. (haha... kidding... although, that would've been PRETTY funny)

I love the old Southern accent. I love saying 'eh' and knowing I can because I'm Canadian. I love hugs. I love writing in my blog. I love going to bed on time. I love not waking up to my alarm clock. People never fail to amaze me. I think i've figured out the extent of our stupidity and our rude characteristics and then some asshole proves me wrong. Where I work there are some rich old bastards who think they're so smooth. I want to give them such a big punch in the face but knowing that they're here spending 100 dollars for a hair cut... I think that would be wrong of me. So earlier this week a 50 year old man Terry comes in for a day treatment. When he first walks in he comments on how pretty I am and kisses my hand. I'm sorry but I find this just slightly rude. Maybe some people find that charming but not me. Then today some guy came in and was like "Oh Julie I see you got another pretty bitch" Well gee... thanks. What are we teaching our children? Another surprise came to me while I was washing this 6 year old's hair. (Who gives their children 50 dollar hair-cuts?) While I was washing her hair I was talking to her and she says "Grandma's staying at our house, but only for a few more weeks. Then she leaves" So I asked her... where is your grandma going? Her reply "Oh, she's going where everybody goes." Then I asked her where is that? "Oh, she's dying and going to hell, or at least that's what mom tells me." I have a question. Why do we find it so easy to express love in terms of. I'm madly in love with you... or I've fallen in love with you. But when it comes to the phrase, "I love you" We find it hard to say. Don't the other two put more emphasis on it? Or maybe it's because I love you is pure emotion. It's not focusing on another word to take away the simple meaning we're trying to get across. Maybe when we over decorate things... it takes away from the real meaning. And why is it so much easier to hate then to love?

Update you say Angela? Well considering the fact that you're the only person I listen to when people say that... i'll take your advice. My, this warm weather that we have had lately really gets to me. Well besides the fact that I had a virus in me ATTACKING ME TRYING TO BRING ME DOWN... I have thoroughly enjoyed it. Swinging and such is great fun. I really miss living in a small town. I know that big cities always seem to have more to do but in reality... they don't. See, when I lived in Enumclaw, Washington... I was NEVER bored. I was always doing something with my friends outside and just... being a crazy kid. See, in my neighborhood all the kids would get together and play baseball, kickball, capture the flag, laser tag... all around the neighborhood. True... our neighborhood was one big circle and quite smaller then the one I lived in now... but I loved it. Another thing I loved was that everything was in walking distance. And at the age of 7 I was allowed to walk down to the grocery store by myself... that's how safe it was to live there. It was just awesome knowing everybody... I miss it. Although I do love all of you guys... you're great... even that annonymous person who keeps harassing me. You're cool too, you make me laugh insanely loud, good for you! Ah, the world happens to be okay with me.

I hate it when I have the time to sit there and pick at things that I don't like about myself. See, today at work there was nobody there so I was sitting staring idly off into space just thinking about myself. I've come to the conclusion that there are a lot of things that I should change but probally won't. Like, I believe that I'm too judgemental sometimes, not in the way that as soon as I see someone I mark them right then and there... more along the lines of judging people I already know. Sometimes my friends do things that I disagree with, stupid things, small things, just whatever, and I instantly a thought pops into my head. Not a good one. Or how they act around certain people, or in different situations. They tend to piss me off a lot, I know it's bad but I can't help it. Why do we tend to keep things that we'll never use? I was going through my drawers today and I came across all sorts of things that really have no value in keeping. For example, back in 8th grade I went to the fair with my friends and I played a ring toss game and I won a little stuffed bird. This is something I found in my drawer. I understand why I kept it for a month but 4 years? That's a little insane. The memory is great but the bird in the bottom of my drawer isn't making me remember it. So why don't we throw all these personal tidbits away? Even as I looked at the bird and thought it was pointless to keep it I hesitated to throw it away. There were other things in there like a broken bracelet that i'll never fix, a little keychain that my cousin gave to me for my 10th birthday and such things like that. I ended up throwing most everything away except a few that I still hold more of an attachment to. But even now I feel so empty with out my tidbits. That's it I'm going to cry now. I want my bird back. Today went nice, I don't know why I wore that skirt though. Such a bother.

Mondays really kill me. School is so hard and it's just a bother. And then I get home and there's nothing to do and none of my shows are on. It was raining today, it seems to do that a lot on Mondays. I did end up getting a bathing suit today and Jelly belly's... So it's all good. Anyway, since none of my shows were on I was kind of surfing the television, I know... I'm lazy. But I came across that Swan show on Fox. For you who don't know what it is... They take two girls on each episode and give them a complete make-over (surgery, weight loss, eyes, etc.) and then they choose one of the two to go onto this final "swan pageant". I think there's 12 in all that make it but I'm not sure. Well, I would just like to say how much I disagree with this show. And not just this one but all the make-over ones. Why is everything in our society dependent on how we look? Is physical attraction really that important? And honestly when I see these women that they choose... They are not that ugly. From what I saw all they had to do was learn how to take care of themselves. Maybe lose a few pounds, get a new hair cut, learn how make-up is put on. I mean they weren't the most gorgeous women on earth but they were by far not the most unattractive. And then there's this whole other issue. A lot of the people watching the show are women just like them. Ones that have the opinion that they are ugly and have low self-esteem. Well, I'm sure that show is helping SO much to bring their self-esteem up. They see these women who like them that get their dreams. But for these other people, they most likely don't have the money to afford those kind of operations. So they just end up hating themselves more because they can't be like all those 'other pretty women'. I'm just so fed up with how our society views everyone. If you don't' fit into that one 'perfect category' you are doomed to fail at life and be a social outcast. I understand the need to have a high opinion of yourself. But maybe they should focus more on improving yourself with how you are. Then the people watching them would actually have hope of being able to improve themselves also. It's just frustrating the way we depend on looks to get us somewhere in life.

Alright, I'm back! Not that you knew I was gone or anything. Maybe I had mysteriously disappeared but no... I just went to Utah for the week. Well... Let's review how that went, shall we? The plane ride there was fine, I slept most of the way so I don't really remember it. And then the actual week went fairly quickly. Most of the time it was Becca and I trying to figure out what to do. We went shopping a lot, which was fun... We got matching sweat suits... The cute ones, yeah... We're not cool. And then we just had fun hanging out and watching movies. And I ate boxes and boxes of creamies! Oh yum, if you ever go out to Utah, they have THE BEST popsicles. I'm so sad that you can only get them there. I might have to go out there for college JUST for the creamies. Then I also hung out with my sister and my soon to be brother-in-law, Scott. Who is pretty cool, I think I've thoroughly embarrassed Katherine now. And then I also hung out with my cousins Becca and Tracey, and trust me... The whole double Becca thing was REALLY confusing. But I found out that my cousins are extremely cool. Tracey is cool because he's 25 and still goes on Homestarrunner... Which, is cool. And then my cousin Becca is cool because she hangs out with Clay Aiken, Kimberly Lock, Reuben Studdard and basically a bunch of the other American Idol contestants. And then she baby-sits a bunch of famous peoples kids and such and this wasn't cool to me but she knows everybody on the Everwood set and dated that Ephram guy on the set and the Chris Pratt guy too. Oh well, I don't' know who they are. But I'm sure a bunch of girls are all insanely jealous (Like Angela). But that was basically my vacation, nothing special. Cracker Barrel was the highlight of my week though. Yum. Now let me tell you about the ride home..... "The Trip Through Hell" *Now Appearing in Wide-Screen* So, my plane leaves at 6:25am... Which is hell enough but then it gets even worse. I get on the plane... And there is a baby in front of me, behind me and three to the side of me. They were all crying. So then we start to take off and we stop. It turns out something is wrong with the pressure and they inform us, "there's a technical problem that will take about 15 minutes to fix, don't worry, we'll be off soon!" So apparently "soon" is the two hours that we wait on the plane until they inform us that the plane won't be in service and we'll all have to find another plane. So I get off the plane and go wait in a 40 minute line to get another plane. Which, I could've got on the one right next to us but they wouldn't recheck my bag for me and so I didn't have enough time. So I end up going back down to the ticket booth and recheck my bag for the 12:20 flight, meaning I was stuck at the airport for 6 hours. Luckily I was doing something the whole time except for about 90 minutes. I finally get on this next plane where my seat was a window seat. But when I get there, obviously with my luck there was two large men sitting in both the window and aisle seat. So, not really wanting any confrontation (extremely unlike me, I don't know what was up with me) I just sat in the middle. That wasn't too bad because I fell asleep. Then I sat at the Dallas airport for 2 hours and was bored out of my mind. Finally I got on the plane and was by myself! Or so I thought. Then at the VERY LAST possible moment this huge Australian man sat on the aisle seat. So I was still okay... Until later. So he started talking to me, which is fine, but I couldn't understand anything he was saying. And then he sat next to me for some odd reason and was asking me all sorts of wired questions like where are we going? And what day it was? And my address... And my name? So I was like... uh, not answering the last two. Then when there was a moment of silence I got out my music and pretended to go to sleep. So he decides that I'm not really going to talk and he moves up to the seat in front of me to bug this other lady and to drink some rum. So with all that space I lied down to go to sleep. And lucky me I slept for most of the plane trip. When there was about 30 minutes left I woke up and decided to go put on my headphones (because somewhere in this story I had taken them off) and lay back down. So he saw that I had got up and decides since the other lady didn't want to talk (he had realized that when she told him if he snored when he went to sleep she was going to punch him) that he would try with me again. So he comes back and sits down and I'm like "hey, not having my head near your ass" and I decide to sit up. Well he pats his leg and says "no, it's okay!" And I shake my head and say, "no, that's alright". Well because I'm basically the most naive person in the world when I'm drop dead tired, I decide that when I see lightning flashing outside that I should tap him and tell him to look at it. So I guess in Australia doing something like that is an invitation for him to hit on me. So he scoots over again and puts his hand on my leg and then puts his other hand around me and on my arm rest. Well, that... Is not right. So I push his hand off my leg, take my arm off the hand rest, and scoot up so his arm isn't touching me. Well that still doesn't get the idea across to him that I didn't agree with what he was doing. So he puts his hand back oh my leg. Well I pushed it off and said, "don't' touch me." Well that still doesn't get across and he moves his other hand off the rest and onto my ass. Uh... No. I grab his arm and move it back to him and said once again, "don't' touch me." So finally he leaves me alone and scoots back over to the other seat. Then back again he comes like 5 minutes before we land and he starts asking the same questions again. And he then says "you're 21 right?" ... NO I'M 16! WILL YOU FREAKY PEOPLE LEAVE ME ALONE! I KNOW SOMETIMES I LOOK 18! But PLEASE! When I'm in a sweat suit, no make-up and my hair is in a messy bun... I LOOK 16! GRrrr... There are some SICK SICK people in this world. Arg, so after he finds out I'm 16, he REALLY leaves me alone. So when everyone is getting up to get off the plane he gives me a sick smile and beckons me to go before him. I shake my head and say no. Luckily before that this old lady behind me, really nice lady, had been talking to me. And she had asked if I was okay and that if I wanted her to walk out with me. Yes, yes I did. Then she waited with me until my dad came. When that Australian saw my dad, yeah... He didn't come near me. That's right buddy... You watch out my dad will kick your fucking ass! Sick people.... sick sick people. I feel so disgusted and violated. Alright and just to make clear. I have nothing against Australians, I think they're pretty cool. Except the dirty ones, I don't' like perverts of any type. Gross. And Sean there is your update. And Elaina... you're cool.

Because I haven't written in awhile and I really don't have time to do it tonight either... I'm going to do the topic that we Jeremy H. and I were talking about. The Issue of Washing Heads and Scalps... Tori: I have a squishy scalp Jeremy: squishy maby you should get that checked out Tori: see, from working in a salon i've realized that there are many types of heads and scalps Jeremy: Let's discuss heads Tori: there's they type that doesn't fit in the bowl ... those are really hard to wash because it's hard to get the hose around to their hair; then there's the head that's too small so water easily runs down their backs; then there's the heads that move a lot and it's hard to wash becuase it's like you're finger is slipping in their ear or up their nose; then there's the heads that fall asleep and don't have any movement at all and those are hard because they tend to be very heavy heads; Desire 596: and then there's the heads that are perfect Jeremy: okay now... let's describe scalps Desire 596: and when you are washing the hair it's like your fingers are digging into some mud or something Jeremy: what does that mean? Tori: well... not really that deep Jeremy: like it pushes in or soemthing Tori: but... like.. the top layer, it just... sinks Jeremy: so squishy is good Tori: and then their is the scalp that has like... no hair on it... or very thin hair and it's hard and it's hard to wash hair becuase it's just weird Tori: and then there are the scalps that have endless bumps and nicks to them and it's like you're washing mountains and valleys and you begin to wonder if that's normal; then there are the scalps that have no hair... and you're really confused on what you're supposed to wash... and the scalp is bleeding in places and you're just confused and not sure what to do and you want to throw up when you touch it... I had to wash that scalp today... it was unpleasent Jeremy: oh man gross Jeremy: thats dangerouse Jeremy: a bleeding scalp Jeremy: what this teaches me is to never got to a spa becuase if i do the person who was washing my hair is going to describe my scalp to other people
