My parents decided to ask me why I hated the family so much and well I wouldn't anwser them. In fact, I barely talked at all and I didn't really pay much attention to them. My dad finally got really pissed off and cussed me out and then yelled at me and called me a damn liar. Of course, that's right... I'm such a horrible liar because I didn't wear a sweater over my prom dress. I'm the devil, that's right. Oh yeah... I'm grounded from everything except going to work. Don't bother trying to do things with me... it won't work out.

So I'm back from camp. Whoop-dee-do... I wish I was still there instead of this hell hole. Today was my birthday and I just had the MOST WONDERFUL DAY! When I woke up my mother came into my room yelling at me about how I was going to make them all late to church. Then I went to church and we all know how much I love going there. When I came home my mother decided that because I'm such a horrible child she'd go looking through my room for things to get me in trouble with. So she found some pictures where I was wearing a tank top and my prom dress without a sweater! Oh HEAVEN FORBID! I'm such a horrible child. So she yelled at me for that. Later that night my friend Becca called. She lives with my sister out in Utah and she had a question to ask me. It had something to do with the rent and some stuff that was my sisters fault. She asked me what to do and I basically told her to tell my sister to fuck off and that she can take her shit and shove it back up herself. Well my mother overheard my conversation and pulled me into the room with my dad so they could yell at me and tell me that I should stick up for my sister. They apparently didn't like it when I told them that I didn't like my sister so why would I stick up for her when she's a bitch. And of course my parents didn't believe me when I told them that Katharine was such a bitch to me when I was a kid. And you want to know what I got for my birthday? I got a bag to carry my make-up in when I go places. Oh joy... that's so useful because I travel so much. Happy Birthday to me... I just love everyone right now.
Well I'm off for the week! I won't be back until the 19th and then the 20th is my birthday! I know you guys remembered that and have my presents all wrapped up and ready to go! I'll be back!

Technology really gets to me sometimes. It's amazing, wonderful and all of the above but sometimes I just think its too much. Mainly because I don't understand it and I get awfully frustrated sometimes. But right now, nobody is helping me and I really want to scream! So, Utah was awesome and everything but I was really looking forward to coming home. I mean, my own bed, my own bathroom, my own closet, my own room, my own everything! I was just so excited. Everything was going to be wonderful. I was going to go get all my summer reading done. I was going to go shopping for things for my room. I was giong to hang out with friends. I was going to go quit my job and apply to 10 billion others. I was just ready to move on and get some things done. Then I got home. Apparently while we were gone my cat decided to lay down in the sink and plug it up. Then he turns on the water. For probally 24 hours we had water running out of the sink... from my room. There goes my own bathroom, my own bedroom, my own closet... My room has been completely destroyed. Caroline's room has been completely destroyed. The family room has been completely destroyed. The garage has been completely destroyed. So the construction workers have come and they have taken all the carpet out of my bedroom, they have taken out all of my bathroom floor. And they've cleaned out the other rooms but who cares about them. MY room is important here. Actually, I'm not too bummed. Life is life and you've just got to understand that things are going to happen and there's not much you can do about it. So, I'm just living it up and having friends come over to entertain me. By the way, if you have a house I can spend the night at... that would be wonderful. Because we have all these fans going on in the house that makes it impossible to sleep. I slept at Elaina's last night and we had a blast just being ourselves. So anyway... I have to be at my house while the construction guys are here. There's this really hott one that I'm having fun checking out. Oh yeah, he's a fine specimen of a man. But anyway... oh here he comes. GOT TO GO!

How long have you been waiting? Me... I can't remember when I wasn't. Someone told me that if I wait long enough he'll come. "Who is he?" I asked. They said I would know. So I've sat patiently like they've told me to. I've sat through the rain and the snow. Days have passed and still I've waited. People have walked by and I hoped they were for me... they weren't. I'm still alone. I'm starting to wonder if they were wrong. Maybe the person I'm waiting for is waiting for me. Maybe I'm supposed to be out there looking for him. But what if I leave? Maybe he'll pass by and I'll have missed my chance? But if I don't take a risk, I might be sitting here forever...alone. So I stand up and look around. The place I've known forever is the place i'm going to leave. I turn around for one last glance and then with a smile I turn and leave. And there he is, the "him" I've been waiting for. And all I had to do was take a chance. So, how long have you been waiting? I don't remember when I wrote this... but i just found it and I thought it was pretty cool. I don't think it was meant towards anyone, I think I was just writing.

This is why you should go to Flash Fiction... the one under my blog links because he writes FUNNY things! As a child, Duncan Peregrine had been observed carefully by his parents and teachers. His constant talking to himself seemed to indicate some sort of mental instability. What he was unable to ever convincingly explain to them was that he possessed the unique ability to hear the narration in the story of his life. He tried to get used to it, but it often got on his nerves. Look, no one cares; will you just shut up? Duncan snapped at the narration. What do you mean snapped at the narration? Of course thats who I was talking to. You think I was talking to these people? Sorry, the narration was just trying to do its job. The others in the waiting room looked up at Duncan, confused. Let em look. The woman next to him coughed nervously and stared intently at the magazine in her hands. Duncan flipped through a magazine of his own, but couldnt concentrate enough to read it. He imagined it was the fact that all his actions were constantly being narrated for him inside his head. He wished the narration would just go away for a while, at least during the time Duncan was in the doctors office. So why dont you go for a while, if you know I want you to? he asked. Everyone in the waiting room desperately pretended not to hear him. Fine, the narration answered. Did you just narrate yourself? The narration got a little carried away, is all. Look, just go, Duncan said. Okay, okay. The narration left, and silence returned to the waiting room. Duncan went back to flipping through his magazine. I said go! Fine; the narrations going...
